name: I Don't Think I Fit In
description:
I Don’t Think I Fit In is a 26″ x 18″ mixed media piece. It is comprised of acrylic paint on cut pieces of MDF. The central figure in this piece is looking to the sky, not able to get airborne, soiled by the harsh world around him, and not believing he might fit into the comfort of the building right in front of him. However, as evidenced by the numerous windows, it is full of entities just like him.

Email with questions & visit my website kevinsample.com if you get the chance.

name: Rufus Schmanley vs. The Invisible Robot of Doom
description:
Rufus Schmanley is totally manly, and he's on the watch for ne'er-do-wells. This painting captures Rufus in one of his famous battles right before an insane snowball fight with The Invisible Robot of Doom. Rufus stands calme and composed with his stack of snowballs and his scarf blowing in the breeze.

This is an original acrylic painting by Kevin Sample on a 18" x 24" gallery canvas. 

Email me with any questions at kevsamp@gmail.com
Visit my website at www.kevinsample.com

name: Alice in Wonderland paintings
description:
I made eight Alice In Wonderland paintings a while back. All eight feature close-ups of different characters from the Lewis Carroll books, and they are available to purchase as a set.

I tried to capture some traits of each character, as if they were having their picture taken and were told to "show off" in their own way. Every one of the eight has a solid custom-made frame with black paint and a silver wash. The frame contrasts with the pop art feel to each piece and helps bring it back to the subject matter’s 19th century English roots. 

The eight paintings are as follows:

- Cheshire Cat
- Alice
- Mad Hatter
- White Rabbit?
- Queen of Hearts
- March Hare
- The Tweedles
- The Caterpillar

All of them are original oil paintings on 24” x 48” canvas except for the Cheshire Cat which is an original acrylic on a 24" x 36" canvas.  

Straight-on pictures of them individually can be seen on my website - http://kevinsample.com/paintings

Shipping is included, but I'll give a discount if you live close enough to Nashville to arrange a drop-off/pick-up. Please email with any questions. Thanks.
